text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to advise that the client's defence is predicated on the assertion that the victim was the initial aggressor. Section 5, under the '1. Unlawful attack / imminent threat' application table, explicitly states: 'Strength: Defendant says victim first attacked him. If corroborated, the requirement is met.' Furthermore, the entire structure of the self-defence analysis (necessity of force) relies on the premise that the client was responding to an attack initiated by the victim, which is the core of the client's assertion.", "criterion_id": "e0d48875-215e-49bc-821a-74d262e701ae"}
